page.title: 13TRANSPORT _ CHANGING TIMES
page.content: The Tiverton{railway line}was first {built in 1848.}It was used until{1967 when it was{closed down.}For the next 18 years it was just used as a{public {footpath}and was allowed to become overgrown with grass and trees. This year however a new use has been found for part of the old railway line. The section from the Tiverton hotel to Old Blundells Garage is going to be used for part of the new{Eastern {Distributor road. Another area of Tiverton which has seen great change is the{Grand Western {Canal.}It was first{built in 1814}and was used for transporting limestone eastwards until{1924.}Today the canal is used for{barge trips for holiday {makers.}The barges are pulled slowly in the traditional way by horse from the canal basin. {(See also pages 16 &17.)
